definition: to become/to turn into
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
surname Cheng
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
God became man

sentences.english: The lesions will "bleach out" and become clean wounds that will heal after a molt.
sentences.chinese: 病变会“漂白了”，成为清洁伤口愈合后，将蜕皮。

sentences.english: And fire raised man above all animals .
MBL's work is truly amazing, thank you for letting me be a part of it.
sentences.chinese: MBL的工作确实是惊人的，谢谢你让我成为一部分。

sentences.english: Becoming a winning poker player means knowing when to quit.
sentences.chinese: 成为扑克中的赢家意味着你知道何时收手。

sentences.english: And the Northwest Passage in the Arctic became ice-free for the first time in living memory.
sentences.chinese: 在当今人们的记中，北极西北航道首次成为无冰航道。

sentences.english: In Love + Sex With Robots, Levy explains how human-robot love can become a reality.
sentences.chinese: Levy在书中说人与机器间的爱情可以成为现实。

sentences.english: He can hold the ball, and be a target man.
sentences.chinese: 他可以护住球，也能成为一个目标男。

sentences.english: IP has become an important subject in fields of diplomacy and foreign trade.
sentences.chinese: 知识产权已经成为外交外贸领域的重要议题。

sentences.english: Gradually,it became a stage show on its own in the eighteenth century.
sentences.chinese: 在十八世纪，芭蕾渐渐地发展成为了一种舞台表演。

sentences.english: But, if a man bites a dog, that might make front-page news.
sentences.chinese: 但是，如果人咬了狗，那倒可能成为头版新闻。

sentences.english: It is now the highest-grossing independent British film of all time.
sentences.chinese: 如今，这已成为迄今为止最成功的英国独立电影。

sentences.english: Going blind was the watershed of my life.
sentences.chinese: 失明成为我人生的一个分水岭。

sentences.english: Therefore, statuary had turn into a three-dimensional political picture poster.
sentences.chinese: 由此，雕塑成为了一种立体的政治“宣传画”。

sentences.english: If a new strategy works, then it will be adopted and further routinized as a rule of thumb.
sentences.chinese: 如果新办法行得通，以后就会沿用而成为经验法则。

sentences.english: Freaky monster you whether to become the new king of monsters you?
sentences.chinese: 奇特的怪物你是否成为新国王的怪物吗？

sentences.english: Dates become a series of business negotiations, often hard-nosed.
sentences.chinese: 约会成为一系列商务谈判，常常就像讨价还价。

definition: to be done/to be ready/that's enough!/that will do!
one's conduct/deed/activity/accomplishment/achievement/to act as/as (in the capacity of)/qua/to view as/to look upon (sth as)/to take sth to be
to change into/to turn into/to become
to sink down to/to be reduced to (sth inferior)
is/are/am/yes/to be
variant of 是[shi4]/(used in given names)
one of (sth)/one out of a multitude/one (third, quarter, percent etc)
not just in name only, but also in reality (idiom)
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
surname Cheng
see 的士[di1 shi4]
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
aim/clear
really and truly
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
nowadays/now
surname Ye
also/too/(in Classical Chinese) final particle implying affirmation
to rise (in society)
pronoun/synonym/byword
however/yet/but
(emphasizes that sth is precisely or exactly as stated)/precisely/exactly/even/if/just like/in the same way as
